(3 comments)
Why this device is added to PSU sensors? hwmon temp sensor already supports IIO device

According to IIO the device driver, an IIO sensors will create single or multiple channels of power, voltage, current and other sensor information. And PSUSensor can use labels to get data from the different exposed paths, So add it to PSUSensor.
ACK
why are these removed?
Sorry for lost the part of debug log. I added this part in the right place.
move block to line 372
Done
use condition on devType?
Done. Update this condition with devType.
Done.

This still looks odd to me because devType does not change for inside this for loop, yet there are multiple conditional statements inside the the loop for devType. 
Maybe this function can be refactored as a follow up patch

> This still looks odd to me because devType does not change for inside this for loop, yet there are multiple conditional statements inside the the loop for devType. 
> Maybe this function can be refactored as a follow up patch

The 'matches' parameters is used to set the initial sensor value unit of PSUSensor,  so add '{"voltage", sensor_paths::unitVolts}' to 'sensorTable'.

My point is that devType does not change within for loop at https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/58513/7/src/PSUSensorMain.cpp#574.

How about add a variable for matchIndex and set outside the for loop?

if (devType == PSU) matchIndex = 1
else matchIndex = 2;

> My point is that devType does not change within for loop at https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/58513/7/src/PSUSensorMain.cpp#574.
> 
> How about add a variable for matchIndex and set outside the for loop?
> 
> if (devType == PSU) matchIndex = 1
> else matchIndex = 2;

Done. Define this parameter in the above structure.

There are string constants scattered. Can we add a map/structure that define them in the same place, for maintainability?

devType, path, matchRegEx

> There are string constants scattered. Can we add a map/structure that define them in the same place, for maintainability?
> 
> devType, path, matchRegEx

This seems like a better way to maintain it, so add a struct to define the same place here. Here set different devType, deviceName, matchRegEx and nameRegEx for Hwmon and IIO devices, thanks for your suggestion.
Friendly ping.
Done
query : can Index be negative ...?

> query : can Index be negative ...?

No, it can only be a positive integer. Thanks for your reminder.
As per guidelines, it is recommended to use enumClass.
Done

What does macthIndex = 0, 1 and 2 mean? 
Should we make it an enum?

> What does macthIndex = 0, 1 and 2 mean? 
Only 1 and 2 are meaningful. ```matchIndex``` is get paramater as sensor type from filename.

The hwmon file name is in_input/curr_input/temp_input and the iio file name is in_voltage_raw/in_temp_raw.
If the device type is hwmon, set this to 1 and use the first part of the argument as the sensor type, e.g., ```in```/```curr```/```temp```.
If it's iio device, set 2 and get the second, e.g., ```voltage```/```temp```.


> Should we make it an enum?
It seems unnecessary to make it an enum.
Isn't is better to return true/false from the function and pass psuSensorParams as parameter as an argument?

> Isn't is better to return true/false from the function and pass psuSensorParams as parameter as an argument?

Yes, this seems like a better way to pass psuSensorParams information.

success or failure can be returned from getDeviveParameters function 
and continue can be done if getDeviveParameters returns failure.

No need to return default value.

> 
> const map <devType, string, regex> MatchParams
> {
> HWMON, R"(\w\d+_input$)", "([A-Za-z]+)[0-9]*_")
> IIO, ....
> }

Set all `regex` parameters to map and reset `nameRegex` to string type.

Do you want to adjust it like this? Or am I misunderstanding something?
